Updated November     pm



Mississippi State Universitys Gender Studies Program will host its sixth annual Feminist Film Festival at  p.m PERIOD from Nov PERIOD  in the Turner A PERIOD Wingo Auditorium in Old Main PERIOD

Kimberly Kelly a professor in the Gender Studies Program said this event will show four commercial films all thematically surrounding feminism PERIOD

 Kelly said PERIOD

Kelly said some issues which are prominent in the films are related to themes of gender sexuality and racial inequality PERIOD

Melanie Walsh a Gender Studies Program graduate assistant said there is a theme including these issues set aside for each night PERIOD

Every night through Nov PERIOD  the program will show one movie with a panel and questions following it PERIOD These movies are specifically set to be thoughtprovoking in different ways PERIOD

This years line up includes    and  PERIOD Walsh states that  was brought in to highlight international issues  highlights issues with people of color the  sheds light on LGBTQ issues and Thursdays blockbuster movie is  PERIOD

 Walsh said.Walsh noted the way the movies were chosen was through the gender studies faculty members PERIOD

 Walsh said PERIOD

Kelly noted an important role to make this film festival happen is to make sure panelists are booked PERIOD

 Kelly said PERIOD

After doing this the panel opens the floor up to questions for the students at the event PERIOD

Walsh said the panelists consist of gender studies scholars who play an important role in engaging the students PERIOD

Walsh agreed with Kelly regarding critical consumption as a goal of the event PERIOD

 said Walsh PERIOD

Margaret Hagerman an assistant professor of sociology and a panelist for this years festival said she believes this festival can bring the MSU community together in an impactful way PERIOD

 said Hagerman PERIOD

The Gender Studies Program encourages anyone who is interested to come to watch the films and stay after the showings for the postshow panel discussion PERIOD
